statement:
A useful result allowing us to define the “smallest” analytic variety is
the following.

Let $G \subset {\mathbb{C}}^N$ be an open set, then an arbitrary
intersection of complex analytic varieties in $G$ is a complex analytic
variety in $G$.

[9]{} Hassler Whitney. [**]{}. Addison-Wesley, Philippines, 1972.
names: intersection of complex analytic varieties is a complex analytic variety
